title: Relates to qualifications for certain appointed positions with the board of trustees for the state university and CUNY
summary: Relates to qualifications for certain appointed positions with the board of trustees for the state university and CUNY; prohibits trustees from being employees of the appointing authority.

       Introduced  by M. of A. LANCMAN, JAFFEE -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Higher Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to trustees of the  state
         university and city university

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section  353  of  the  education  law,  as
    2  amended  by  chapter  127  of  the  laws  of 2006, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    1. The state university shall be governed, and all  of  its  corporate
    5  powers  exercised,  by  a board of trustees. Such board shall consist of
    6  seventeen members, fifteen of whom shall be appointed  by  the  governor
    7  with  the  advice  and  consent  of the senate, one of whom shall be the
    8  president of the student assembly of the  state  university,  ex-officio
    9  and  voting;  PROVIDED  THAT NO SUCH MEMBER, EXCEPT THE PRESIDENT OF THE
   10  STUDENT ASSEMBLY OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY OR ANY CLASSIFIED CIVIL SERVICE
   11  EMPLOYEE, SHALL BE THE EMPLOYEE OF, OR UNDER  THE  SUPERVISION  OF,  THE
   12  GOVERNOR,  and  one  of  whom  shall  be the president of the university
   13  faculty senate, ex-officio and non-voting. Such ex-officio members shall
   14  be subject to every provision of any general,  special,  or  local  law,
   15  ordinance,  charter,  code,  rule,  or regulation applying to the voting
   16  members of such board with respect to the  discharge  of  their  duties,
   17  including,  but  not limited to, those provisions setting forth codes of
   18  ethics, disclosure requirements, and prohibiting  business  and  profes-
   19  sional  activities.  One  member of the board shall be designated by the
   20  governor as chairperson and one  as  vice-chairperson.  Of  the  members
   21  first appointed, two shall be appointed for a term which shall expire on
   22  June  thirtieth,  nineteen hundred fifty-two; one for a term which shall
   23  expire on June thirtieth, nineteen hundred fifty-three; two for  a  term
   24  which  shall  expire on June thirtieth, nineteen hundred fifty-four; one

    1  for a term which  shall  expire  on  June  thirtieth,  nineteen  hundred
    2  fifty-five;  two  for a term which shall expire on June thirtieth, nine-
    3  teen hundred fifty-six; one for a term which shall expire on June  thir-
    4  tieth,  nineteen  hundred fifty-seven; two for a term which shall expire
    5  on June thirtieth, nineteen hundred fifty-eight; one for  a  term  which
    6  shall  expire  on June thirtieth, nineteen hundred fifty-nine; two for a
    7  term which shall expire on June thirtieth, nineteen hundred  sixty;  and
    8  one  for  a  term which shall expire on June thirtieth, nineteen hundred
    9  sixty-one. Vacancies shall be filled for the unexpired term in the  same
   10  manner  as  original  appointments.  The  term of office of each trustee
   11  appointed on or after April first, nineteen hundred eighty-six shall  be
   12  seven  years, except those of the student member and the faculty member.
   13  Trustees shall receive no compensation for their services but  shall  be
   14  reimbursed  for their expenses actually and necessarily incurred by them
   15  in the performance of their duties under this article.
   16    S 2. Paragraph (a) of subdivision  2 of section 6204 of the  education
   17  law,  as added by chapter 305 of the laws of 1979, is amended to read as
   18  follows:
   19    (a) The board of trustees shall consist of seventeen trustees. Ten  of
   20  the  trustees  shall  be  appointed  by the governor with the advice and
   21  consent of the senate; PROVIDED THAT NO SUCH TRUSTEE, EXCEPT ANY CLASSI-
   22  FIED CIVIL SERVICE EMPLOYEE, SHALL BE  AN  EMPLOYEE  OF,  OR  UNDER  THE
   23  SUPERVISION  OF,  THE GOVERNOR.  Five of the trustees shall be appointed
   24  by the mayor of the city of New York with the advice and consent of  the
   25  senate;  PROVIDED  THAT  NO  SUCH  TRUSTEE,  EXCEPT ANY CLASSIFIED CIVIL
   26  SERVICE EMPLOYEE OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK, SHALL BE AN  EMPLOYEE  OF,  OR
   27  UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF, THE MAYOR OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK.  One ex-of-
   28  ficio trustee shall be the chairperson of the university student senate.
   29  One  ex-officio  non-voting  trustee  shall  be  the  chairperson of the
   30  university faculty senate.
   31    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply  to  board
   32  members  of  the  state  university of New York and trustees of the city
   33  university of New York appointed on or after such effective date.
